content: And that's obviously why we're spending a lot of time talking about Vivity and penetration, and trying to work a series of programs on the ground that actually engage surgeons in the process of the pre-op work that's required but also importantly the knowledge and use of Vivity, which I think at this point is one of the kind of no regret moves in ophthalmology. And I think as we think through this year, we expect to be back to kind of what I would loosely call normal growth rates plus a little bit, given that there's some pent-up demand out there.
